utterance.speaker: REPORTER
utterance.content: Regina, your new album Fatal Impact drops next week. What can you tell us about it?

utterance.speaker: REGINA CANE
utterance.content: It’s about love, heartbreak, and revenge. It’s my best album yet.

utterance.speaker: REPORTER
utterance.content: Oh my God, it’s Josie Lang!

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: What the hell is Josie Lang doing at my release party?

utterance.speaker: PUBLICIST
utterance.content: Her album’s out next week, too. Having both of you here gets us more press.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: More press for who? Me or her?

utterance.speaker: JOSIE
utterance.content: Regina! Thank you for the invite. You know, you’re the reason I’m a pop star. I’ve been a fan ever since I was in grade school.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: That is ridiculous. I do not lose a turn.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding? No, that’s the rules. You absolutely lose your turn. Ask him. Esposito!

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ask me what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In a relationship, if you choose a movie and you choose very, very poorly, do you lose your turn?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How poorly?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You should lose two turns.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just saying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Those are the rules.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Those are the rules.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, the body was found in this dumpster over here by a homeless dude that was looking for cans. It was wrapped up in this tarp.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: GSWs. Near as I can tell, she was shot at close range. Minimal blood seepage and lack of spatter in the area suggest she was killed elsewhere then dumped here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So someone was hoping she’d catch a ride with the morning haul. Disappear into some landfill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea who she is?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Well, according to her ID her name is Holly Rhodes. But her business card has her listed as DJ Beat. Called the number and her booking agent said she was DJ’ing an album launch party in SoHo last night for pop star Regina Cane.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? Oh, dude … you remember that music video where she was dressed up as a sexy little Girl Scout? I don’t care what those cookies cost, I would sell my left –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Anyway, she was booked at the party until 1AM.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: 1AM?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m placing the time of death between 11 and midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whatever happened, happened at that party.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This ink looks fresh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s an unlisted number. I got a call in to the phone company.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you guys set up a canvass for anyone who saw the body dump. Castle and I’ll head down to SoHo, see what happened last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh-kay. Good morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Killer party.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it looks like Regina went all out to promote her new album.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I remember when Alexis used to play her big hit "Call Me Crazy" over and over again. Drove me crazy. Of course, it was no Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, NYPD. Where’s the host?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Forget the host, where’s your pants? Am I right? No, I’ve been there. Check by the pool.

utterance.speaker: REGINA KING
utterance.content: Wait, you’re NY what now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: PD. As in … a detective. We’re here about Holly Rhodes.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Who’s Holly Rhodes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: DJ Beat? She was your DJ for your party.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Oh. That skank. That b*itch almost ruined my entire party. When I left to get ready for my performance she was supposed to stay and get the crowd pumped. Instead, the music stopped and she was gone.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: She didn’t even come back to get her equipment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying that she left early?

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Yeah. Around 11 after jacking in a playlist. I didn’t pay for a playlist. If you see her, tell her I want my money back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That might be a little tough, seeing as she’s dead. She was killed just after leaving your party.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Great. Now I feel bad for complaining.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you notice any unusual behavior? Was she having problems with any of your other guests?

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: No. But then again, I was busy making my rounds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. Well, I’ll need a guest list along with the names of everyone that was working … last … night.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: No problem. I’ll have my publicist send it right over.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I spoke with several of the other party guests and they confirm Regina’s story. Apparently Holly just suddenly left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the middle of her set? Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we answer that, we’ll find out why she was killed. Anyone see where she went?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, and there’s no security cameras. I’m seeing if I can pull tape from the businesses across the street.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get ahold of next of kin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, she doesn’t have any. Holly was an only child. Bounced around foster care until she was 18.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That can’t have been an easy childhood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Probably why her hobbies as a teenager include burglary and shoplifting. Then she graduated to grand-theft.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything more recent?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not in the last 7 years. She must have cleaned up her act when she got serious about being a DJ. Oh, and get this. The uniforms canvassing Holly’s apartment building found a neighbor who saw a man pounding on Holly’s door a few days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was it about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Neighbor said he screamed ‘you won’t get away with this’. Either Holly wasn’t home or she wouldn’t answer the door and eventually the guy took off. Neighbor’s with a sketch artist as we speak.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I got a hit on that phone number written on Holly’s hand. It belongs to a Tyrese Wilton. Apparently he’s some big time record producer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s on the guest list. He was at the party.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys see what he knows. Castle, Lanie knows where our victim was killed.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I noticed it when I was cutting her out of her clothes. Stains on her outfit. The lab identified it as peanut oil with high concentrations of MSG.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meaning … what? She was eating Chinese food and spilled some on herself?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Except I checked the contents of her stomach. No Chinese. And they weren’t serving any at the party, either. So I checked with CSU. They said there was no trace of it in the dumpster, but it’s all over the tarp, meaning …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She may have been killed at or near a Chinese restaurant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Narrowing it down to every single block in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … what about the gun?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The slug is from a .380 but there were no ballistic hits in the system. Oh, and when CSU processed the tarp and the clothes they also found these. Synthetic fibers. They didn’t come from the dumpster either, but the lab is still running tests. I’ll keep you posted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If Tyrese is such big time, why is the entrance to his studio in an alley?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because. Celebrities don’t want paparazzi taking their picture all the time. Yo. Did you just do the hair thing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What hair thing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Every time you’re about to meet a celebrity or a pretty girl you run your hand through your hair.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: TMZ said that Tyrese was at that party with Josie Lang. He’s producing her new album.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah well, she’s no Regina.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I understand the image of her as a girl scout is seared into your memory, but Josie is a real vocalist.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whose fan base consists of 12 year old girls … and you.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE WILTON
utterance.content: Stand by.

utterance.speaker: JOSIE LANG
utterance.content: Hey Ty, you want me to take that from the second bar?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Sorry Jo, we’ve got to take 15.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, since Josie was at the party I should probably take her statement, right? You got this, right bro? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Sorry, this is such a crazy thing. I can’t believe she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How well did you know Holly, Tyrese?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: I met her for the first time at the party. I was there with Josie because we had been working on her album and I used to produce Regina back in the day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you tell me why we found your phone number written on the victim’s hand?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: What, that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: I gave her my digits so we could set up a meeting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: If there’s one thing I’m good at, it’s spotting talent. Her mashups and beat match were better than most of the guys droppin’ albums today. I was blown away. I told her I wanted to take her to the next level.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So how did she react to that?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: She was thrilled. Said a break like this is what she’d been working for. She was supposed to call me today.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You have any idea why she rushed out of that party early?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: No. Could’ve had something to do with that fight, though.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What fight?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: You heard of MC Thug?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: MC Thug? Yeah, the rapper. He’s been shot, like, 7 times, right?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: That’s the one. Now on Holly’s first break, he walked up to her booth, starts talking to her real low and angry. I could see she was getting upset, trying to push him away. But he grabbed her wrist and said ‘next time, it’s gonna end different’. Then he saw me coming and bounced. I was going to talk to her about it, but you know, I got caught up with some folks. Next thing I knew, she was gone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This MC Thug. You see him at the party anymore after Holly left?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: No. In fact, I didn’t see him the rest of the night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So if you could just make it out to Jenny and Kev. It’s short for Kevin.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Fanboy. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you, so much. She’s going to die when she sees this. Thank you! Nice to meet you!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: MC Thug. AKA Darius Carson. His rap sheet includes assault with a deadly weapon and attempted murder. And that was just at this year’s hip hop music awards.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did Holly wind up in the sights of a guy like that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, whatever was going on between them started way before that party. The guy that was pounding on Holly’s door, threatening her? The sketch came in from the neighbor. Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Darius Carson.

utterance.speaker: DARIUS CARSON
utterance.content: No one calls me Darius unless you my momma. And by the looks of that body, you ain’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m sure your momma’s so proud.

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Darius. According to Regina Cane’s party planner you weren’t on the original guest list until you made a last minute phone call to get in the party.

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: I’m a fan of her music. That a crime?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but murder is.

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: I know you ain’t a cop with that fancy shirt and poufy hair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He might not be, but I am. Are you sure you went to the party to see Regina?

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m real sure. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know you visited DJ Beat’s apartment before the party. We know that you fought with her that night, and then she turned up dead.

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with that mess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but you had something to do with her.

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: Damn straight. I wanted my girl’s bracelet back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who had your girl’s bracelet?

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: I threw a party at my crib last week. I hired DJ Beat to spin. The next day, my girl Dakota realized her diamond bracelet is missing. Now that b*itch and the little b*itch of an assistant are the only ones there that I couldn’t vouch for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The b*tch had an assistant b*tch?

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: Yeah, the little punk that works for her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you tracked her down to the party and when she ran you followed her and you killed her.

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: No, I told her she had a day to cough it up. Or else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or else what?

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: Or else is usually enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you between 11 and midnight?

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: Upstairs. With my girl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dakota.

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: Different girl. Kaya.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, I’m going to have to hold you while we look in to that.

utterance.speaker: CARSON
utterance.content: Good. That helps my street cred. You guys are going to do a mug shot, right? ‘cause I brought my lighting guy with me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks. Hey guys. So Kaya confirms she was “hanging out” with MC Thug in one of the bedrooms ‘til 12:30.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And he did file a police report about the missing bracelet, so I requested a list of all the parties that Holly worked in the past year. Of the more than 50 events, turns out that thefts were reported in 7 of them. The MO was the same every time. Mostly high-end jewelry. In total, almost half a million bucks. All from parties at upscale residences. And I also confirmed with Holly’s booking agent that she always worked with an assistant. Paul Travers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmkay, so the of them were a crew using her DJ skills to access high-end homes and then cleaning them out along the way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She does have a history of theft, so maybe she went back to her old ways.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if the assistant were at the party with her, where is he and why hasn’t he come forward?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s only one reason. He was involved.

utterance.speaker: PAUL TRAVERS
utterance.content: Involved in what? My friend is dead and now you’re saying, what, that we were like Bonnie and Clyde?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paul, thefts were reported at seven of the parties that you both worked.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Oh, and because of her history it’s gotta be her? Music saved her. She was done with that life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what about you? According to Holly’s agency, you were responsible for setting up and breaking down the equipment.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you never broke it down last night. You left the party and never came back, same as Holly, only you’re still alive and she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Last night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I wasn’t even there last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paul, don’t lie. She’s got you listed on her invoice.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Yeah, I – I know. A few times this past year she’d call me up last minute to say she was using another guy. It was like her cousin or something and he needed the work. I know she felt back about it because she still offered to pay me anyway.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I was at a birthday dinner yesterday night. I have witnesses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which of these parties did the other guy work?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: This one, this one, here - – this one, this one, this one, and … that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The same ones that reported robberies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So far only one witness, a caterer, remembers seeing a guy setting up Holly’s equipment last night. And she only saw him from behind and he was wearing a hoodie, so we reached out to other party guests, see if we can get a better description.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So was anything stolen from the party last night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. We asked everyone and so far no one’s reported anything missing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So unis searched Holly’s apartment again. There’s no sign of the stolen goods. And there’s no influx of cash into her account, so if she was making money off this thing, there’s no evidence of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if this mystery assistant is the one behind it all? I mean, think about it. He forces Holly to get him into these parties. While she’s busy spinning, he’s free to walk around these fancy apartments. And since he’s hired help, nobody pays him extra attention. It’s candy from a baby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But when MC Thug confronted Holly, she got scared. So she threatened to blow the whistle on the assistant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that would certainly give him motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But with Paul’s name on the invoice, there’s no record of him. How’re are we going to find him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He helped set up that equipment last night, right? His fingerprints would be on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get CSU on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, grunt work. I’ll come back later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So long as you leave the coffee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you find?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Holly’s phone records. She received calls from a payphone in Washington Heights the same days she was booked for the parties where the thefts happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe it’s her mystery assistant calling for details.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Holly grew up in the Heights so it might be someone from the old neighborhood, but it doesn’t bring us any closer to finding him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Doesn’t need to. CSU matched a print on that equipment to one Joey Malone, street name Monster. He’s got a list of priors a mile long. Unis took him down in Washington Heights. He’s in the box. Go take a look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Monster. Now that sounds like the kind of ganged up thug that would shoot you dead and leave you in a dumpster someplace. Probably half man, half mountain, full of prison tats. Or is he quietly dangerous? Like Javier Bardem in any movie where he’s got weird hair.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just … take a look for yourself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Behold. Monster.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More like Cookie Monster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do we know about this kid?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he’s not related to Holly, for one. His father died of a drug overdose when he was seven. His mom committed suicide a couple of years ago. His uncle, Martin Decker, is the one who took over guardianship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s his uncle now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s not at home. I notified social services thinking they might know how to reach him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said he had priors?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, he was busted for breaking and entering, burglary, resisting arrest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now he’s moved up to the big leagues.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, uh, what’s the plan here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m gonna go in alone, so he doesn’t feel outnumbered. See what he’s made of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s 14. It’s hard to believe he’s capable of something like this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not in his world it isn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi Joey, I’m Detective Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: JOEY MALONE
utterance.content: A major hottie is what you are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, now that we got that cleared up, I need to ask you a few questions .

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You need permission from my guardian. The last time I checked, I’m a minor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we’re making our best effort to get ahold of your uncle. In the meantime, NYPD policy allows me to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re looking into the murder of Holly Rhodes.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Heard about that. Real sad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I understand that two nights ago you worked for her. Did you see her having problems with anyone?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know why she left the party early?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where she went?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No clue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let me ask you this. Why do you think Holly hired a 14 year old kid with a record to be her tech assistant?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: ‘cause I’m the best.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The best at what? Stealing? Every time you’ve worked for Holly, high-end jewelry has gone missing. Every single time.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I don’t know nothing about that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Holly know about the stealing or did she find out that night? Is that why you killed her?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What – what, kill her? No. No. I didn’t do that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have witnesses that saw you leave the party right after she did and you never came back for the equipment. So where were you between 11 and midnight?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I was at – I was at TV King.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You left the party and equipment to go to TV King in the middle of the night? You’re going to have to do better than that, Joey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You may be allowed to talk to me, but I don’t have to talk back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Robbery and murder? Maybe Monster wasn’t such a bad nickname after all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I’m not so sure about that. He expected the conversation about the stealing, but when I accused him of murdering Holly that threw him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And I think I know why. Joey’s alibi checks out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously? He was at TV King?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The assistant manager sometimes lets him play video games up on the big screen. And that’s where Joey was during Holly’s time of death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, if he didn’t kill Holly then who did?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The brains behind this operation, that’s who. A kid like Joey goes from smash and grab to stealing a half a mil in jewelry? I don’t think so. Someone put him up to this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, it makes sense. Some savvy criminals use minors to do their dirty work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. A Fagin to Joey’s Oliver Twist.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And if Holly’s involved, that makes her the Artful Dodger. Or the Artful DJ.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, nicely played.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that would explain why we never found the stolen loot in Holly or Joey’s apartments. Fagin has it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That gives him motive to get rid of Holly if she ever gave him any trouble.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, if we’re right, Joey knows who our killer is. I get this kid. Let me get a crack at him.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, where’s the super hot detective?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, you’re lookin’ at him. Don’t laugh. I was featured in the NYPD calendar.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Bet that was a big seller. So uh, you must be the good cop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know about that. But I could be your ticket out of this.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah? How’s that work?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know you didn’t kill Holly. All you did was lift a bunch of jewelry.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Man, I didn’t –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just save it. We don’t care about the jewelry. We can take those charges off the table. All we want is the guy who put you up to it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I don’t even know who you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Joey, c’mon. I just gave you the winning lottery ticket. Now the right move here is to cash that in, not tear it up.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I bet this is the part where you tell me I don’t know the seriousness of my situation. How unless I tell you everything that I know you can’t help me. And then you’ll lean in close like you care about me, like you’re my friend. And you’ll make promises you’ll never keep.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I keep all my promises, bro.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: That’s what everybody says.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is a limited time offer, Joey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Not interested.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. I want you to take a look at this. This is how Holly ended up. Shot. Tossed in the garbage. Do you think she deserved that? Hum? Oh, what? No smartass comeback now? You work with this woman. You knew her. The same guy that has you stealing jewelry did this to Holly. He uses kids like you. And then he just gets to walk away while you have to sit in here and answer all my questions. You know what you are to him right now? You’re a loose end. So take a hard look. Because this is your future. This is you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You’re wrong. He won’t hurt me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He won’t. Not once we stop him. All I need is his name, Joey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I still don’t know who you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we think that the thefts were someone else’s idea.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you know of anyone in his life that might have drawn him into this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about his uncle? Where is he now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Guy sounds like a real prize.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We were hoping not it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. He’s not safe out there in the world right now. The guy that we’re after killed a woman. He could do the same thing to Joey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I - I can’t just throw him in juvie. I’m trying to gain his trust here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Cooper, this boy is the key to us solving a murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What if I take him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That way he’s not locked up and I can keep him safe. And I can continue to work on him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s cool. I got this. The kid doesn’t have a father. He probably just needs someone to connect with.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I’d rather have a pajama party with the lady cop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah well, it looks like I drew the short straw. Literally.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Man, no wonder you’re single! No woman would spend time here unless it was against her will.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? What about you, Martha Stewart? What’s you place supposed to be? Shabby chic? Emphasis on shabby?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It’s a dive. But it’s not my fault. My uncle would rather blow all of his money at the tables.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Must be why he’s too busy to call us back.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Don’t wait by the phone. He only cares about claiming me as a dependent.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: My parents split up when I was 5. Man, get your feet off my table. Dad moved to Florida with his new wife. Most I ever got after that was a phone call and a post card.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Post card?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: How old are you, anyway?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ancient. But I’m young enough to remember what it was like. Must miss your folks.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: After my dad died, my mom kept going. You know, she tried to pretend that we were still a normal family. She did her best to take care of me until … she couldn’t do it anymore.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now you take care of yourself.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah. Look, man. I know you didn’t have to do this. Take me in, I mean. So uh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Im’ma go grab you a blanket. Pillow.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, at least you didn’t skimp out on the audio visual budget.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know that’s right. Oh, and I’ve got Assassin’s Creed 3. So go ahead and knock yourself out. Oh, and uh … put it on dual player mode so I can come back and school you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: $20 bucks says you won’t make it past level 1.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re crazy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sit down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. Care to explain?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? The handcuffs?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no. The stylish shoes that you’re wearing. Yes, the handcuffs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, junior here tried to pull a Houdini on me last night.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Who the hell is Houdini?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Out the window?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Down the fire escape?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And then on to a moving garbage truck. Then on a skateboard for five blocks that took him all the way to the L-train.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’d you keep up?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: He didn’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shut up. What the – Give me that. Commandeered this dude’s bicycle. Then he lost me in the subway. But then I caught him. At the next stop. Kid’s wily. But I’m wilier.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wow. Just like The French Connection. In the meantime, CSU was able to ID those fibers found on the tarp that holly’s body was wrapped in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’re they from?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Germany. Based on the chemical composition and color, they’re fibers from carpeting used by a high-end European car manufacturer to line their vehicle’s trunks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmm. Now we know how Holly’s body ended up at the construction site.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU narrowed it down to a model 2010 to 2012 X-5. I’ll canvass around the construction site, see if anyone saw a car like that hanging around the dumpster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we pulled Joey’s juvie files from the central clerk’s office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Theory being, whoever he’s involved with might be in there somewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless he gave you a name.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … no. Not exactly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we find out who Joey got mixed up with, we find our killer. There’s gotta be something in these files that points to him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like he got his first taste with a B and E when he was 11 years old.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He graduated to burglary when he was 12 when he broke into a mom and pop corner store along with an unidentified adult male.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s the one we’re looking for.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, we’re not looking for someone he was busted with. This guy’s smart enough to stay above it all.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check this out. Two months ago someone named Shane Winters bailed him out after he was picked up on a shoplifting charge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shane Winters? I remember that name. When Holly Rhodes, our victim was 17, she was busted on a grand theft charge and check out who posted bail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shane Winters. That’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shane Winters. Trafficking, grand theft, assault with a deadly weapon, extortion. This dude’s dabbled in everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So when Holly was a troubled teen she must have worked with Shane just like Joey is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But then she cleaned herself up, got out of the life.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When he figured out what kind of access she had at the parties, he pulled her back in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that explains why Holly had to hire Joey as an assistant.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just ran Shane Winters. Guess was he drives. 2010 X-5.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That would have the carpet fibers we found on the tarp.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and a roomy trunk for all your body moving needs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We gotta bring him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We tried to. Unis busted in on his last known address. He’s not there.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So what are you? Officer Babysitter?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You get paid extra for doing that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’s Shane Winters?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Where’s my soda?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: LT. You figure you’re special to him, don’t you? Well, you’re not.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Man, you don’t get it. I’m not giving him up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know how much time keeping your mouth shut will buy you with Shane? Huh? As long as it takes him to pull his gun and shoot you with it. And then he’s just going to move on to the next lost kid. Don’t let it end that way, Joey. Just tell me where I can find him.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I’m not a rat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any luck?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Eh, I just want to wring this little bastard’s neck right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I call that a no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’ve got a BOLO out on Shane and his car.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Freakin’ kids, man. I don’t know how you do it, bro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. No, no. I lucked out with Alexis. At a certain point you realize you’re just dealing with someone who hasn’t been around as long as we have. They have to find their way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The problem is, he’s already found his way. He just doesn’t see where it’s going to put him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. No luck on the BOLO, but I talked to Garcia in robbery. We got a tip on Shane’s location. Wanna roll?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what? Let me get this one.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Hey sugar. What’s your poison?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Hello? What’re you drinking?

utterance.speaker: BODYGUARD
utterance.content: Mr. Winters is not taking any meetings today.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can I just get a bag of ice, please?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: What the hell do you want with a bag of ice?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s for him. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: SHANE WINTERS
utterance.content: You must be Detective Esposito. Joey told me you two had been hanging out. Said sooner or later you’d find your way down here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So he warned you?

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: No, he’s a good kid. Dependable.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Put ‘em on. Or better yet, resist arrest. Please.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Some other time maybe.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you know a woman named Holly Rhodes, Shane?

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Name sounds familiar.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, it should. You ran with her back in the day.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Oh, she ran. But not with me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why did you bail her out when she was a teenager?

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Oh, I got a soft spot for kids, man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. You’re just like a regular Mr. Rogers. When was the last time you saw her, Shane?

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Ah … last time I saw Holly. Don’t recall.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, let me help you out with that. It’s three nights ago. When you killed her.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: You’re wrong about that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm, I don’t think so. See, when this whole DJ’ing gig of Holly’s took off, wealthy clients, penthouses, you saw a golden, diamond encrusted opportunity.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And that’s when you pressured Holly into bringing in Joey Malone as an assistant. He’d go into these fancy parties and he’d walk right out the front door with half a million in high-end jewelry. And your hands would stay clean.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: You are right about that part, at least. My hands are clean.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But then something went wrong at the last party. I mean, maybe Holly pushed back. Or maybe she wanted you out of her life once and for all.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But she knew too much, so she had to go.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Look, all I hear you guys saying is a whole lotta stuff that you can’t prove.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we can prove that her body was in your trunk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fibers that stuck to the tarp that Holly was wrapped in match your X-5.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re impounding it right now.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Well then, I guess you guys didn’t hear about it. About the little problem I had with my vehicle this morning. You see, I got a little careless. I was uh, lighting a cigarette and the next thing I know the whole car catches on fire. Inside, outside, the carpet. Whole thing burned to a crisp. I hate to tell you, but there’s probably not a fiber left to match. Crazy how things happen sometimes, huh? So again, whole lotta noise that you can’t prove. That being said, I’d like my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I need a minute alone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You tipped off Shane. After you bolted last night. You called him. Warned him that he was a suspect. Which gave him a change to torch his car. Cover up his role in Holly’s death. Congratulations, Joey. You helped him get away with murder. Now I’d beat your skinny little ass for being stupid if it’d change anything. But it won’t because, well, you’re so loyal. Now, let’s see how Shane returns the favor.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: I can see that you’re a little slow, but I just said I want my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is about the thefts. Somebody’s going to go down for them, and we know it’s going to be Joey Malone. The DA wants to try him as an adult. That means hard time. All you gotta do is man up. Man up about the thefts. Then maybe I can talk to the DA, get Joey a deal.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Look, man. The kid did the crime, he’s gotta do the time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Have you seen enough? You still want to protect him?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Look, it was like you said. I go in with Holly, lift pricey jewelry. The more the better. But this time it was different.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Shane told me that my mark was this music producer. Tyrese –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tyrese Wilton.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. It was weird. I was supposed to boost his cell phone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why his cell phone?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I don’t know. But I took it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? And then what?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Somehow Holly found out. And she flipped. She got in my face and told me to give the phone back. And I got scared because I knew she carried heat, but I had already handed the phone off to Shane. So I – I got out of there and … that was the last time I saw her. I didn’t know she would end up dead. I didn’t know Shane would kill her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So no doubt a guy like Shane would kill her, but it’s starting to look like he didn’t. He’s got an alibi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t believe it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Affidavits from six bar patrons all stating that Shane was there between 11 and midnight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he practically runs the place, so the patrons will say what he tells them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So CSU just confirmed that his car was too burned for them to match the fibers or pull forensics, so we can’t even prove that he transported the vic’s body.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We also can’t tie the murder weapon to him, either. According to her assistant Paul, Holly used to carry around a .380 pistol for protection. She might have been killed with her own gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here’s something that doesn’t add up. Tyrese Wilton’s phone. Why would Shane tell Joey to steal a phone worth a couple hundred bucks? Especially when there had to be so much bling at that party.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dude, nobody says bling anymore. Try shine.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s something else that doesn’t add up. All the guests were contacted and asked if they were missing any personal items. They all said no. So –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn’t Tyrese Wilton mention that his phone was gone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Check this out. It’s Yang Dynasty.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That could explain the peanut oil on Holly’s clothes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s blood spatter on the wall.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like we found our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. And it’s right at Tyrese’s doorstep.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Are you saying that Holly was killed right outside my studio?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s right. So why don’t you tell us what she was doing here.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: How the hell should I know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hum. Then maybe you can tell us what you were doing between 11 and midnight the night of the party.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: I was at the party. I stayed there until just after 1. You can check.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You were also asked if any of your stuff went missing the night of the party. You didn’t mention your phone.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Because my phone wasn’t missing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You don’t have to lie to me, Tyrese. I talked to the kid who stole it.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: I mean, it was missing for an hour or two, but then it turned up. See? I found it in the bathroom at the end of the night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If Joey stole the phone how did it end up back at the party?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoever brought that back didn’t want it missed. Based on Shane’s MO, he was after something valuable, something he could sell. Yo Tyrese, what’s on that phone? Financial info, pictures, valuable data?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Only one thing that really matters. I use this phone as an e-key.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: An e-key?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: An electronic key. It opens up this studio.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, did Holly know that?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Yeah, I mentioned it to her when I discovered it was gone. I went to text her my number, but I had to write it on her hand instead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s why Holly was here. She realized that Shane stole the phone because he was going to rip the studio off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She couldn’t let that happen, not with Tyrese here about to give her her big break.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right, so she races over here to confront Shane to stop him before he ripped you off.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Looks like she did, because nothing’s missing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Positive. I’ve got over two mil in equipment here and nothing – Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: The recordings. If someone got their hands on an unreleased album …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’d be worth a fortune.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Not to mention tanking our record sales if it leaked online.

utterance.speaker: TYRESE
utterance.content: Oh no. Josie Lang’s album was accessed at 11:45 the night of the party. Someone downloaded the masters.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shane.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I’m telling you. Shane’s alibi is rock solid.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How is that even possible?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We interviewed everyone in the bar. We even talked to the cabbies outside. And everyone said that he left around midnight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would he torch his car if he didn’t dump her body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He might have dumped her body, but our timeline says that he did not kill her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait a minute. We gotta be missing something here. So let’s just go over it again. We know that Joey handed Shane that phone around 11. And we know that Josie’s album was downloaded at 11:45. Holly was murdered sometime between 11 and midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. The key to this whole thing is that phone. We’re assuming that Shane was the one that used it to break into the studio.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because he’s the one that Joey gave the phone to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. But witnesses place him at the bar at 11:30 to midnight. The album was downloaded at the studio at 11:45. It had to be someone else.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Like who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ll, it’d have to be someone from the party.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then whoever broke into the studio must have returned the phone to the party so that Tyrese wouldn’t realize that it was even taken.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All we have to do is figure out which one of the guests had something to gain from stealing Josie’s album.

utterance.speaker: DANCE INSTRUCTOR
utterance.content: Five, sex, seven, eight. Rock one, two, three, four. Step. Nice. Good. Point again.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Hi. Did you guys not get the guest list that we sent over?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. We – we did. We just need to ask you a few questions about your schedule the night of the party.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So according to your party planner you excused yourself at 11 to do a costume change for a performance of a track from your new album, is that correct?

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: That sounds about right. But I just go where they tell me to. You know how it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only your planner told us that you insisted on having a full hour.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Have you ever tried changing into skin-tight leather pants? It’s time consuming.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Why? What’s the point?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that hour gave you enough time to get to Tyrese Wilton’s studio, download Josie’s new album, and get back to the party to perform your song.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Are you insane? Why would I do anything like that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because your album sales have been sagging for years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If your album didn’t perform, your record label was going to drop you.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: I’ve been with Harmony 360 for ten years. They love me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s no secret that Josie Lang’s eclipsed you.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Oh please. She’s been around for 2 seconds. Give it a year. You won’t even remember her name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. Both your albums come out next week and she’s going to crush you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless someone mysteriously leaks Josie’s new album online.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your plan was simple. Hire Shane to steal the phone, that way you can get into the studio.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The one thing that you didn’t plan on was Holly. She showed up and caught you just as you were leaving the studio.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you couldn’t risk her exposing you. You fought, she pulled out her gun to protect herself, but you managed to use it on her instead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you called Shane and you got him to get rid of the body.

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? That’s all speculation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The one thing that’s not speculation is that you hired DJ Beat. How did you find out about her?

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: Word of mouth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: More like your bodyguard grew up with Shane Winters. Shane had you hired DJ Beat so that Joey could get in and steal that phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what else isn’t speculation? The warrant she served on your ISP.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That warrant revealed the email account that you created to communicate with the hacker that was going to leak Josie’s album online. Is that enough fact for you?

utterance.speaker: REGINA
utterance.content: My record sales may be down, but I can still afford a damn good lawyer.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: You keep showing up here like this, the boys are going to think you’re sweet on me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not anymore they won’t. Huh. You are walking on grand larceny and accessory after the fact. Wow. Now, that kind of luck does not last long.

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Well, I guess I’ve gotta go play the Powerball then tonight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is my gun. And this one will be yours. You ever go near Joey, or any other kid, ever again, the story’s going to go like this. You pulled that piece on me. And I had to defend myself. So I killed you. You understand me? Or should we play out that story right here, right now?

utterance.speaker: WINTERS
utterance.content: Um … I hear you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Reach back there and grab that file.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What am I? Your secretary?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just grab the file.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Haven’t I done enough to solve this case for you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Read it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Juvenile record for Javier … Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. The good old days.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So assault, resisting arrest, unlawful possession –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You were a mess.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. But it’s all I knew. My dad was gone, my mom was working two jobs. In my neighborhood, you had to do what you had to do to survive. Not everybody made it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Is this where you tell me to man up and get my act together like you did?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. It doesn’t work like that. You need help. For me it was one of my teachers. Saw a future in me that I didn’t even see in myself. But it was up to me to make a choice. To pick which road to go down. I talked to your school counselor –

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s going to call me if you keep ditching.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: C’mon, man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And I’m going to call you once a week. Check in.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: All right. I’ll go. If you agree to get new furniture.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You can’t get laid on the regular with that junk you have. I’m just looking out for you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here. If you need anything, day or night, call me at that number.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Okay. You’re all right. For a cop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I know. Now get out of my car.
